pr_title: Add documentation for sending requests with an absolute URI

timeline.message: Add documentation for sending requests with an absolute URI

timeline.author: trustin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,7 @@
 # Calling an HTTP service
 
+You can create <type://WebClient> with a base URI and send a request with a relative path.

timeline.author: trustin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -23,6 +25,43 @@ AggregatedHttpResponse res3 = webClient.post("/upload", "{ \"foo\": \"bar\" }")
                                        .aggregate().join();
 ```
 
+You can also create <type://WebClient> without a base URI and send a request with an absolute URI.
+The ad-hoc <type://WebClient> would be useful in the following cases:
+
+- Send requests to arbitrary endpoints
+- Build a proxy server
+- Handle redirected requests

timeline.bodyText: @tobias- told me this did not work for him. Could you double-check if this example works as expected?
timeline.author: trustin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -23,6 +25,43 @@ AggregatedHttpResponse res3 = webClient.post("/upload", "{ \"foo\": \"bar\" }")
                                        .aggregate().join();
 ```
 
+You can also create <type://WebClient> without a base URI and send a request with an absolute URI.
+The ad-hoc <type://WebClient> would be useful in the following cases:
+
+- Send requests to arbitrary endpoints
+- Build a proxy server
+- Handle redirected requests
+
+```java
+import com.linecorp.armeria.common.HttpStatus;
+import com.linecorp.armeria.common.HttpHeaderNames;
+
+// Create a WebClient without a base URI.
+WebClient webClient = WebClient.of();
+
+// Send a request with an absolute URI.
+AggregatedHttpResponse res1 = webClient.get("http://example.com/foo/bar.txt")
+                                       .aggregate()
+                                       .join();
